nodes.name: Document To Text
nodes.description: The DocumentToText node extracts text content from documents, including PDF, TXT, DOCX, and image files, located in a specified file path or directory. It processes either a single file or an entire directory, producing a structured DataFrame with columns for the extracted text, file name, page numbers, and optionally, base64-encoded data for PDFs and images.

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
This workflow:


  • Reads a PDF file
  • Uses LLM to generate the test cases
  • Parses the JSON reponse from the LLM into individual records.
  • Finally saves the test cases.
fields.title: Comment
fields.description: Comments for the Workflow

nodes.name: Interactive LLM Agent
nodes.description: This node enables standalone or dataframe-optional LLM queries across multiple providers (OpenAI, Bedrock, Gemini). It is designed for sequential agent flows like 'Similar Company Finder' and supports saving structured responses.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: llmConnection
fields.title: Select Connection
fields.description: Select Connection

fields.name: customPrompt
fields.value:
You are an experienced enterprise QA Engineer. Your task is to generate a complete, professional test suite based on the following Business Requirements Document (BRD) document.








Each test case must follow a structured format and be ready for inclusion in a formal QA test management system (e.g., TestRail, Zephyr, QMetry). Do not include any conversational text, explanations, or filler content. Simply return the test cases, cleanly and precisely formatted.
Context for TestCase Generation,create Testcases strictly based on specified details in the context query
${context)



Output Format:
Return a valid JSON object with a single key "items" containing an array of item objects.




JSON Structure (with example):
{
 "items": [
  {
  "filename": "filename.pdf",
   "test_case_id":"RG-UPL-01-01",
   "test_case_title": "test_pipeline_to_execute_wf_in_emr_cluster_jan9 Pipeline",
   "test_case_description": "Pipeline executed on emr cluster",
   "status": "0"

  }
  // Additional item objects...
 ]
}


Section Mapping & Extraction Logic:
- filename
Extract name of the input file, convert any comma and brackets to underscore in the filename.
Example: "filename": "filename.pdf"




- test_case_title
Give a title to the testcases created
Example: "test_case_title": "test_pipeline_to_execute_wf_in_emr_cluster_jan9 Pipeline"






- test_case_description
A short description of the test case created, do not specify the test_case_id or test_case_title. Do not club multiple variations in a line, each variation must have it's own record.
Example: "test_case_description": "Pipeline executed on emr cluster"
        Verify admin can create user for head office.
         Verify admin can create user for head district.
         Verify admin can create user for head upazilla office.


        Verify registration of basic information for trainer including Name.
        Verify registration of basic information for trainer including Gender.
        Verify registration of basic information for trainer including Designation.
        Verify registration of basic information for trainer including Organization name.
        Verify registration of basic information for trainer including Subject specialization.
        Verify registration of basic information for trainer including Mobile_no.
        Verify registration of basic information for trainer including E-mail address.
        Verify registration of basic information for trainer including NID.









Resets for each test_case_title




- status
status of the testcase, set default as "0".


0 -> created




1-> reviewed




3->approved




4->rejected


- test_case_id
Assigns a ID to each testcase, there can be multiple ID's for each test_case_title.
Example: "test_case_id":"RG-UPL-01-01, EG-UPL-01-02"


Extraction Rules:
Match data across all sections using filename, test_case_title and test_case_id




Set missing or unavailable fields to an empty string ""




Normalize OCR-related issues before extraction


Return only a valid JSON object  no markdown, comments, or extra text
